skills.name: skill-creator
skills.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.

skills.name: skill-installer
skills.description: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos).

skills.name: wide-research
skills.description: Orchestrate Wide Research (large-scale parallel research) in Codex CLI by splitting a big task into many independent subtasks, generating child prompts, running them concurrently via `codex exec`, caching raw materials, aggregating results with scripts, and polishing a final report with citations. Use when the user asks for “Wide Research/大规模调研/并行调研”, needs to process many URLs/items, or wants a repeatable research→aggregate→report pipeline that avoids context-window truncation.

skills.name: worktree
skills.description: Git worktree management for isolated parallel development. Use when user mentions "worktree", "parallel development", "isolate branch", "parallel branches", or when detecting multi-module changes, multi-repo work, risky/experimental refactors, long-running features, or context switching that benefits from separate working trees.
